name: Quality Inn Colchester

reviews.text: Choice Hotels has sure improved as far as customer service is concerned, if this place in Cochester is any indication. We stayed one night in July and were very pleased. The desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable-- not large, but with every useful amenity, all in good working order. The breakfast space is very nice and roomy, even at the morning rush-- with a better selec tion of items than most places, including eggs, french toast, and the now ubiquitous waffle maker. The corrdors seem a little worn, perhaps some restoration is being planned. All in all, we had a very nice stay, which exceeded our expectations.
reviews.title: Quality Inn Coclhester-- Exeeded Expectations
What's with the charge for the safe?
reviews.text: Apparently when you sign in to this hotel the fine print says that if you use the safe you must pay $3. If you don't tell them whether or not you used the safe, $3 appears on your credit card! This is just a really bad idea and causes far more ill-will than it's worth.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anyway, the hotel is fairly good, breakfast nice and staff polite.
reviews.title: Very clean, Nice Staff

reviews.text: Me and my gf went for the 4th of July in Burlington. And we found that for the price the hotel was great, bed was really comfortable , Staff was nice, the bathroom was clean and nice
reviews.title: Okay for a weekend trip
too dirty in the entrance and cockroach in the room
reviews.text: Since we didnt get to check in until almost 1 am, I was pleased to find a smiling desk clerk when I arrived. I really like that you need your room key to get onto the elevator to reach the higher floors! The room was a little dated and can use some updating--the bathroom door would not shut properly and the AC is old and it was difficult to find the control panel to even turn it on. We never got maid service our second morning but I did see them out there working. We were on the second floor and the outside balcony was right over the pool area. The pool is very nice and clean, but if you don't like to hear children playing in the pool, get a first floor or outside room.....it was kind of loud. They have a nice complimentary breakfast buffet with a do-it-yourself waffle maker, eggs, sausage, cereal, fruit, & yogurt. It was easy to find and close to where we needed to go at UVM. THERE WAS AN AMAZING DINER WITHIN WALKING DISTANCE, "LIBBY'S DINER," which had a fantastic breakfast in an old-fashioned diner car. I would go back there again.

This hotel is highly over priced....go to S Burlington to the Holiday Inn Express and Suites and get a lot more for the money! I am disappointed that the Quality Inn chain would have their brand tainted by this hotel...and staff!! Aren't there any requirements?? The breakfast was the only positive but they were constantly out of coffee!!!
reviews.title: Stay someplace else!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a fine hotel for our needs to be in town for a 6 AM surgery. Room was not huge, but perfectly adequate. There were some rather gross stains of mold or something on the grout in the shower (room 139), but no biggie in the scheme of things. Old fashioned cathode ray TV, very comfortable bed and pillows, comfy chair, FREE wifi. Convenient to I 89.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Reasonably Priced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the rooms at Quality Inn to be older rooms but they were very clean. The extended breakfast was wonderful. We dont find many hotels that offer such a great breakfast. We'd stay again for the breakfast alone.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a King room which included breakfast. The room was large and the bed was comfortable. Very little noise from adjoining rooms or the hallway. Minimal noise from the bathroom. This motel was only about 5 miles from Burlington which was a nice plus. My only complaint was that the "full breakfast" was the same as other places continental breakfast with the addition of fake scrambled eggs and sausge links.
reviews.title: Pleasant enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Okay---4th stay now with this hotel and time to say, *** Place to stay when in this area ***
reviews.title: ** First place I now check when going to area **

reviews.text: The staff was very helpful and attentive, however, I am not sure that the "manager" whoever this may be, is putting much attention to the bed linens. Every morning we woke up with the contour sheets off of the mattresses. One of our group observed the staff trying to make up one of the beds and it was a huge struggle trying to fit them over the corners of the mattress. Complete your good service by providing appropriate contour mattress sheets. I heard another patron mention this upon leaving and she was told "they are working on it"...whatever that means. Just do it!
reviews.title: Good service, lousy linens

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Quality Inn at Colchester has seen better days; the owners really need to invest in refurbishing this hotel. Despite its tired appearance the attitude and enthusiasm of the staff compensated and ensured we had an enjoyable stay.
reviews.title: Tired building, but staff try hard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sadly the nearby MacDonalds also disappointed, but our waffle breakfast and accompanying cereals, juices etc the next day set us up nicely for our journey.
reviews.title: Our second home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We regularly travel to Burlington Vermont throughout the year to sail in the summer and enjoy the outdoors in the winter and have stayed at the Quality Inn for at least the past 8 years. Originally it was a Fairfield Inn, then the Vermont Maple Inn and now its a Quality Inn. During the past two years the inn has gone through many positive changes under the leadership of Vik the hotel manager. The mattresses were changed, the breakfast room tripled in size and a workout room with decent equipment was added. The breakfast has been expanded to included bacon/sausage and eggs. Just recently the room furniture was replaced, the heating/air conditioning systems refurbished and room fridges are being installed.
reviews.title: UGH!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Since we stay at the inn so often and there is a low employee turnover we have come to know the staff by name. They always give us a warm welcome and are attentive to our needs.
reviews.title: Great value - a bit noisy

reviews.text: This hotel was clean and quiet. However, the room we stayed in for two nights was quite small, there was no closet, and the bathroom barely had any counterspace. The hotel is very convenient to the highway, a gas station/convenience store, some fast food restaurants, and the excellent Libby's Blue Line Diner. The hotel is only a few miles from Burlington.
reviews.title: Not very Marriott-like
Yuck
reviews.text: I would recommend staying at the Wyndham Hotel in Burlington instead....while it's pricier, the accommodations are much nicer and the views of Lake Champlaign are gorgeous, and you're within walking distance to the Church St Marketplace and most of Burlington's excellent restaurants.

No baseboards, old decor, breakfast is weak, but what counts theist- actually slept well in a motel room. Tons of people stay while motel six parking lot is empty. Right next to I95. Front staff speak English well whole others it can be difficult.
reviews.title: Beat up but slept well!

reviews.text: This hotel is conveniently located right off the I-89. The room was clean and confortable and the breakfast was good. Our only complaint was that the room was VERY warm when we arrived and took a good hour to cool down.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: Very good breakfast although it started a bit late, 7AM I believe. Nice little fitness center with good condition cardio and strength machines. Rooms were clean, had a fridge and microwave, beds were decent.
reviews.title: Clean and reasonable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for one night. Our room was a little small and worn looking, but it was clean and the bed was comfortable. We had our heat turned down as low as possible, but it was still pretty hot in the room. The staff were nice and the breakfast area is sunny and nice to eat in. This was a good price for what you get, especially compared to some other hotels in the area.
reviews.title: average hotel, good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've been staying here on and off throughout Oct. while looking for an apartment and working in the Burlington area. Overall, it's been fine. I've stayed in nicer places, but they could do a lot worse. The staff is friendly and accommodating. The beds are reasonably comfortable, there's always plenty of hot water, and breakfast and wifi are included. Depending on which room you're in, the wifi can be a little slow. The breakfast is always the same and, with the exception of the waffles, its pretty mediocre. It's your standard free hotel breakfast of mini muffins, yogurt, bagels, bread, greasy sausages, weird egg patties and terrible coffee. They do allow dogs and one of the rooms we stayed in had a smattering of dog hair on the floor. The only time we had a noise problem was when we ended up with a connecting room. It was in that room that we also had a bit of an odor problem when our neighbor sprayed A LOT of really nasty cologne right by the connecting door. After that we made sure to ask for a non-connecting room. You can also get a room with a fridge and microwave at no extra charge.
reviews.title: Solidly o.k.

description: We offer complimentary FULL HOT breakfast each morning, with make your own waffles, high speed wireless internet, seasonal outdoor heated pool, fitness room, 24 hour business center, 24 hour coffee/tea service in our lobby and fresh baked cookies served each evening. We are conveniently located just off of I-89 exit 16, with several dining options adjacent or close by. We are also only 3 miles from the Burlington Waterfront & Lake Champlain.
